added_lines: def test_name_match_first(self): obj_utils.create_test_node(self.context, uuid=uuidutils.generate_uuid(), name='node-1', power_state='power on', resource_class='x-large', provision_state='available') node = obj_utils.create_test_node(self.context, uuid=uuidutils.generate_uuid(), name='node-2', power_state='power on', resource_class='x-large', provision_state='available') obj_utils.create_test_node(self.context, uuid=uuidutils.generate_uuid(), name='node-3', power_state='power on', resource_class='x-large', provision_state='available') allocation = obj_utils.create_test_allocation(self.context, name='node-2', resource_class='x-large') allocations.do_allocate(self.context, allocation) allocation = objects.Allocation.get_by_uuid(self.context, allocation['uuid']) self.assertIsNone(allocation['last_error']) self.assertEqual('active', allocation['state']) node = objects.Node.get_by_uuid(self.context, node['uuid']) self.assertEqual(allocation['uuid'], node['instance_uuid']) self.assertEqual(allocation['id'], node['allocation_id']) self.assertEqual('node-2', node['name'])

commit_message:
Fix redfish RAID failed tasks

Redfish Tasks do not report failures via HTTP status codes. Instead
have to check TaskState and TaskStatus.

Story: 2009767
Task: 44244

Change-Id: I8f9a89d18d22d18a2e695fde894bcd27f18f8954
(cherry picked from commit 196d8f7fc055667af501ea0569ba5c501a2c6e8d)

added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fixes the determination of a failed RAID configuration task in the ``redfish`` hardware type. Prior to this fix the tasks that have failed were reported as successful.

(cherry picked from commit dd1cb46f2b0146524f0cb4d3579ac5c5b9a6fa45)

commit_message:
Fix prepare ramdisk for 'wait' states

Node can be in CLEANWAIT or DEPLOYWAIT during async step
handling when it needs another reboot. Without this change
node fails to boot back to IPA.

This unifies all occurrences and create utility method for
reuse. All occurrences are aligned to have the same set of
states in case they are needed in future.

Change-Id: I685c5827a70df4abb358635d89b86894671ac493
(cherry picked from commit dd1cb46f2b0146524f0cb4d3579ac5c5b9a6fa45)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/56/848356/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # NOTE(TheJulia): If this method is being called by something # aside from deployment, clean and rescue, such as conductor takeover, # we should treat this as a no-op and move on otherwise we would # modify the state of the node due to virtual media operations. if node.provision_state not in (states.DEPLOYING, states.CLEANING, states.RESCUING, states.INSPECTING):

commit_message:
Minmum TTL value is zero

According to IETF https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2181#section-8 the
definition of the ttl value is unsigned and can have a minimum
value of 0. This path changes the minimum value of 1 to allow for
0 in recordset creats and updates. Unit test have also been modified
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1926429
Change-Id: I9b08e25a007bea598442da377dc227538f6e35f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/44/849644/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_create_recordset_with_zero_ttl(self): fixture = self.get_recordset_fixture(self.zone['name'], fixture=0) fixture['ttl'] = 0 response = self.client.post_json( '/zones/%s/recordsets' % self.zone['id'], fixture) # Check the headers are what we expect self.assertEqual(201, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) def test_update_recordset_zero_ttl(self): # Create a recordset recordset = self.create_recordset(self.zone, records=[]) # Prepare an update body body = {'ttl': 0} url = '/zones/%s/recordsets/%s' % (recordset['zone_id'], recordset['id']) response = self.client.put_json(url, body, status=200) # Check the headers are what we expect self.assertEqual(200, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) # The action and status are NONE and ACTIVE as there are no records self.assertEqual('NONE', response.json['action']) self.assertEqual('ACTIVE', response.json['status']) self.assertEqual(0, response.json['ttl']) # Check the zone's status is as expected response = self.client.get('/zones/%s/recordsets/%s' % (recordset['zone_id'], recordset['id']), headers=[('Accept', 'application/json')]) # Check the headers are what we expect self.assertEqual(200, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) self.assertEqual(0, response.json['ttl'])
deleted_lines: def test_create_recordset_with_zero_ttl(self): fixture = self.get_recordset_fixture(self.zone['name'], fixture=0) fixture['ttl'] = 0 body = fixture url = '/zones/%s/recordsets' % self.zone['id'] self._assert_exception( 'invalid_object', 400, self.client.post_json, url, body) def test_update_recordset_zero_ttl(self): recordset = self.create_recordset(self.zone) body = {'ttl': 0} url = '/zones/%s/recordsets/%s' % (recordset['zone_id'], recordset['id']) self._assert_exception('invalid_object', 400, self.client.put_json, url, body)

Previously, quickstart.sh installed the latest code from the master
branch of Ansible OpenStack collection. Later, TripleO would install
its own release of the Ansible OpenStack collection from RDO RPMs,
but this release would be shadowed by the quickstart.sh release,
causing compatibility issues due to wrong combinations of AOC and
OpenStack SDK.

We now install the latest release of Ansible OpenStack collection
from Ansible Galaxy which is compatible to the RDO RPMs. Of course,
this approach will break once we want to use two separate releases
depending on the RDO branch we are in. But atm we have no other
approach to decouple the upstream git repository of AOC from
TripleO Quickstart.

We cannot drop AOC from quickstart.sh completely because e.g.
Ansible role os_tempest [1] uses openstack.cloud.* modules. If we
drop AOC, then role os_tempest fails [2] because it does not use
the AOC release that got installed from RDO RPMs even though the
path to the RPM installed collection is in ansible.cfg [3]
which is used in quickstart.sh [4].

commit_message:
Change Ansible OpenStack collection to stable/1.0.0 branch

Previously, quickstart.sh installed the latest code from the master
branch of Ansible OpenStack collection. Later, TripleO would install
its own release of the Ansible OpenStack collection from RDO RPMs,
but this release would be shadowed by the quickstart.sh release,
causing compatibility issues due to wrong combinations of AOC and
OpenStack SDK.

We now install Ansible OpenStack collection from its stable/1.0.0
branch which is compatible to the RDO RPMs. Of course, this approach
will break once we want to use two separate releases depending on
the RDO branch we are in. But atm we have no other approach to
decouple the upstream git repository of AOC from TripleO
Quickstart.

We cannot drop AOC from quickstart.sh completely because e.g.
Ansible role os_tempest [1] uses openstack.cloud.* modules. If we
drop AOC, then role os_tempest fails [2] because it does not use
the AOC release that got installed from RDO RPMs even though the
path to the RPM installed collection is in ansible.cfg [3]
which is used in quickstart.sh [4].

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_tempest
[2] https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/testproject/+/43963/3
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/src/branch/master/ansible.cfg#L19
[4] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/src/commit/b48d869e14de40444d69a107a0b718b5f721e912/quickstart.sh#L595

Change-Id: Id47d94d72c206bd6b61ea7a1ac9e896591d83cd6

commit_message:
Drop Ansible OpenStack collection from job requirements

Ansible OpenStack collection is not used by TripleO Quickstart.
It is used within TripleO Ansible et al but Ansible OpenStack
collection is used via RPMs from RDO for that.

Change-Id: I551d46e612038a739c34dc6738de85344b7f1be7

commit_message:
Fix yoga release notes

The yoga RNs failed to mention the added support for Juju
resources to the glance-simplestreams-sync charm and how
this benefits air-gapped environments due to the necessity
for the Simplestreams snap.

Closes-Bug: #1921832
Change-Id: I72974d0297bcd46f3bd848e973677bbf92e37174
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/51/849151/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: glance-simplestreams-sync: endpoint change ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~glance-simplestreams-sync: Juju resources support and snap install ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The glance-simplestreams-sync charm has gained support for Juju resources. Since Simplestreams is now installed via a snap, offline environments can benefit by being able to supply the snap as a resource.

Gerrit.

added_lines: .. note:: More detailed information for working with Gerrit can be found in the upstream documenation (e.g. the `OpenDev workflow`_ page). Install ``git-review`` ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The Git subcommand tool that you'll need to interface with Gerrit is called :command:`git-review`. Install it now: .. code-block:: none sudo apt install git-review .. LINKS .. _OpenDev workflow: https://docs.opendev.org/opendev/infra-manual/latest/gettingstarted.html

commit_message:
Update the charmcraft.yaml for xena (no 22.04 base)

- Build on 20.04 amd64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- Pin tempest for python<3.8
- Drop python35-charm-jobs and openstack-python3-ussuri-jobs
- Add openstack-python3-xena-jobs

Change-Id: I24a77a06c2d6e4ca591d6a8cec9da218d364d992

commit_message:
Migrate charm charmhub for stable/wallaby

- start from stable/wallaby branch
- Do charmcraft, osci, zuul changes
- Modify libs to point to stable/wallaby for:
  - charmhelpers
  - charms.openstack (as needed)
  - zaza & zaza.openstack.tests
- Remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub.io (ch: prefix + channels)
- Build on 20.04 amd64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64

Change-Id: Icded4d9a64925a8308313a423519f991bbb7da8d

commit_message:
Support amphora log offloading over TCP

Add new log_offload_protocol parameter that sets the
[amphora_agent]/log_protocol setting in Octavia's configuration.

Change-Id: I2e4aa150268118085d99502e931fe0b42cc54a9a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/84/847584/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: protocol: "{{ log_offloading_protocol }}"
deleted_lines: protocol: udp

commit_message:
models: Remove implicit coercion of SELECT to scalar subquery

Resolve the following SAWarning warning:

  implicitly coercing SELECT object to scalar subquery; please use the
  .scalar_subquery() method to produce a scalar subquery.

Change-Id: Ib0f8ddaef230292fa55e513c94fbd32a4a1977bc
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/64/837164/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .correlate_except(Service) .scalar_subquery(), .correlate_except(Service) .scalar_subquery(), .correlate_except(Service) .scalar_subquery(),
deleted_lines: .correlate_except(Service), .correlate_except(Service), .correlate_except(Service),

subject: Replaces tenant_id with project_id from Flavor Access APIs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-12-18 11:59:48.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/6c80bf1bf10d7c647bb6c12180ae7d4bc35f38cb', 'message': "WIP:Replaces tenant_id with project_id from Flavor Access APIs

This patch replaces 'tenant' with 'project' from bellow APIs:

- ``GET /flavors/{flavor_id}/os-flavor-access (List Flavor Access
  Information For Given Flavor)``
- ``POST /flavors/{flavor_id}/action (Add Flavor Access To Project
  (addProjectAccess Action))``
- ``POST /flavors/{flavor_id}/action (Remove Flavor Access From Project
  (removeProjectAccess Action))``

This patch also replaced ``addTenantAccess`` action with
``addProjectAccess`` action from ``Add Flavor Access To Project`` API,
and replaced ``removeTenantAccess`` action with ``removeProjectAccess``
action from ``Remove Flavor Access From Project`` API.

Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id
Change-Id: I6853efb82c97bf0528c48d4860d573e31c1c988f

commit_message:
Replaces tenant_id with project_id from Flavor Access APIs

This patch replaces 'tenant' with 'project' from bellow APIs:

- ``GET /flavors/{flavor_id}/os-flavor-access (List Flavor Access Information For Given Flavor)``

Renaming below API name:

- ``POST /flavors/{flavor_id}/action (addTenantAccess)`` (to ``addProjectAccess`` action)
- ``POST /flavors/{flavor_id}/action (removeTenantAccess)`` (to ``removeProjectAccess`` action)

This patch also replaced ``addTenantAccess`` action with
``addProjectAccess`` action from ``Add Flavor Access To Project`` API,
and replaced ``removeTenantAccess`` action with ``removeProjectAccess``
action from ``Remove Flavor Access From Project`` API.

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id

Change-Id: I6853efb82c97bf0528c48d4860d573e31c1c988f

commit_message:
Remove use of pkg_resources

Use of this library has significant performance implications. While
we're probably not too badly affected, we don't actually need to use it
here. The 'parse_version' utility it exposes is intended to parse
PEP440-compliant version identifiers, not the simple microversions
placement uses, which the 'microversion_parse' library can competently
parse for us.

Change-Id: I9b7281caec6fa53600dea316492d052787cf799b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

deleted_lines: import pkg_resourcesCMD_STATUS_MIN_MICROVERSION = pkg_resources.parse_version( status.MIN_PLACEMENT_MICROVERSION) seen_microversion = pkg_resources.parse_version(microversion)

commit_message:
Minmum TTL value is zero

According to IETF https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2181#section-8 the
definition of the ttl value is unsigned and can have a minimum
value of 0. This path changes the minimum value of 1 to allow for
0 in recordset creats and updates. Unit test have also been modified
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1926429
Change-Id: I9b08e25a007bea598442da377dc227538f6e35f7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/15/849515/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_create_recordset_with_zero_ttl(self): fixture = self.get_recordset_fixture(self.zone['name'], fixture=0) fixture['ttl'] = 0 response = self.client.post_json( '/zones/%s/recordsets' % self.zone['id'], fixture) # Check the headers are what we expect self.assertEqual(201, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) def test_update_recordset_zero_ttl(self): # Create a recordset recordset = self.create_recordset(self.zone, records=[]) # Prepare an update body body = {'ttl': 0} url = '/zones/%s/recordsets/%s' % (recordset['zone_id'], recordset['id']) response = self.client.put_json(url, body, status=200) # Check the headers are what we expect self.assertEqual(200, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) # The action and status are NONE and ACTIVE as there are no records self.assertEqual('NONE', response.json['action']) self.assertEqual('ACTIVE', response.json['status']) self.assertEqual(0, response.json['ttl']) # Check the zone's status is as expected response = self.client.get('/zones/%s/recordsets/%s' % (recordset['zone_id'], recordset['id']), headers=[('Accept', 'application/json')]) # Check the headers are what we expect self.assertEqual(200, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) self.assertEqual(0, response.json['ttl'])
deleted_lines: def test_create_recordset_with_zero_ttl(self): fixture = self.get_recordset_fixture(self.zone['name'], fixture=0) fixture['ttl'] = 0 body = fixture url = '/zones/%s/recordsets' % self.zone['id'] self._assert_exception( 'invalid_object', 400, self.client.post_json, url, body) def test_update_recordset_zero_ttl(self): recordset = self.create_recordset(self.zone) body = {'ttl': 0} url = '/zones/%s/recordsets/%s' % (recordset['zone_id'], recordset['id']) self._assert_exception('invalid_object', 400, self.client.put_json, url, body)

added_lines: def test_create_recordset_with_zero_ttl(self): fixture = self.get_recordset_fixture(self.zone['name'], fixture=0) fixture['ttl'] = 0 response = self.client.post_json( '/zones/%s/recordsets' % self.zone['id'], fixture) # Check the headers are what we expect self.assertEqual(201, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) def test_update_recordset_zero_ttl(self): # Create a recordset recordset = self.create_recordset(self.zone, records=[]) # Prepare an update body body = {'ttl': 0} url = '/zones/%s/recordsets/%s' % (recordset['zone_id'], recordset['id']) response = self.client.put_json(url, body, status=200) # Check the headers are what we expect self.assertEqual(200, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) # The action and status are NONE and ACTIVE as there are no records self.assertEqual('NONE', response.json['action']) self.assertEqual('ACTIVE', response.json['status']) self.assertEqual(0, response.json['ttl']) # Check the zone's status is as expected response = self.client.get('/zones/%s/recordsets/%s' % (recordset['zone_id'], recordset['id']), headers=[('Accept', 'application/json')]) # Check the headers are what we expect self.assertEqual(200, response.status_int) self.assertEqual('application/json', response.content_type) self.assertEqual(0, response.json['ttl'])
deleted_lines: def test_create_recordset_with_zero_ttl(self): fixture = self.get_recordset_fixture(self.zone['name'], fixture=0) fixture['ttl'] = 0 body = fixture url = '/zones/%s/recordsets' % self.zone['id'] self._assert_exception( 'invalid_object', 400, self.client.post_json, url, body) def test_update_recordset_zero_ttl(self): recordset = self.create_recordset(self.zone) body = {'ttl': 0} url = '/zones/%s/recordsets/%s' % (recordset['zone_id'], recordset['id']) self._assert_exception('invalid_object', 400, self.client.put_json, url, body)

commit_message:
Replace all_tenants with all_projects in List Server APIs

This patch will replaced 'all_tenants' with 'all_projects' from List
Servers APIs:

- GET /servers (List Servers)
- GET /servers/detail (List Server Detailed)

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id

Change-Id: Ifb1d2a3438ca0869d6816c4759d6f8f1868a982a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/11/765311/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(brinzhang): Since microversion 2.88, we have replaced # 'all_tenants' with 'all_projects'. if api_version_request.is_supported(req, min_version='2.88'): all_projects = common.is_all_projects(search_opts, 'all_projects') search_opts.pop('all_projects', None) else: all_projects = common.is_all_projects(search_opts, 'all_tenants') search_opts.pop('all_tenants', None) if all_projects: all_tenants=all_projects)
deleted_lines: all_tenants = common.is_all_tenants(search_opts) search_opts.pop('all_tenants', None) if all_tenants: all_tenants=all_tenants)

commit_message:
Replace tenant_id with project_id in Limits API

This patch replaces 'tenant_id' with 'project_id' from bellow APIs:

- ``GET /limits (Show Rate And Absolute Limits)``

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id

Change-Id: Ic0a633ab41e22fca03b2ef0084485475d31cf610
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/62/768862/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class LimitsControllerTestV288(BaseLimitTestSuite): def setUp(self): super(LimitsControllerTestV288, self).setUp() self.controller = limits_v21.LimitsController() def test_index_query_param_with_project_id(self): absolute_limits = { "metadata_items": 1, } req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank("/?project_id=fake_project", version='2.88') def _get_project_quotas(context, project_id, usages=True): return {k: dict(limit=v, in_use=v // 2) for k, v in absolute_limits.items()} with mock.patch('nova.quota.QUOTAS.get_project_quotas') as \ get_project_quotas: get_project_quotas.side_effect = _get_project_quotas self.controller.index(req) def test_index_query_param_reject_tenant_id(self): absolute_limits = { "metadata_items": 1, } req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank("/?tenant_id=fake_tenant", version='2.88') def _get_project_quotas(context, project_id, usages=True): return {k: dict(limit=v, in_use=v // 2) for k, v in absolute_limits.items()} with mock.patch('nova.quota.QUOTAS.get_project_quotas') as \ get_project_quotas: get_project_quotas.side_effect = _get_project_quotas exc = self.assertRaises( exception.ValidationError, self.controller.index, req=req) self.assertIn("'tenant_id' was unexpected", str(exc))

subject: Replace tenants* with projects* of policies

commit_message:
Replace tenants* with projects* of policies

Replace the list servers's policies with projects*:

- Replace 'os_compute_api:servers:index:get_all_tenants' with
  'os_compute_api:servers:index:get_all_projects'.

- Replace 'os_compute_api:servers:detail:get_all_tenants' with
  'os_compute_api:servers:detail:get_all_projects'.

- Replace 'os_compute_api:os-flavor-access:add_tenant_access' with
  'os-flavor-access:add_project_access'.

- Replace 'os_compute_api:os-flavor-access:remove_tenant_access' with
  'os-flavor-access:remove_project_access'.

- Replace 'os_compute_api:os-simple-tenant-usage:index' with
  'os_compute_api:os-simple-project-usage:index'.

- Replace 'os_compute_api:os-simple-tenant-usage:show' with
  'os_compute_api:os-simple-project-usage:show'.

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id

Change-Id: Ie0649deb042a8f62bd5be25729748a3f99e297ca
Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/15/765315/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context.can(server_policies.SERVERS % 'detail:get_all_projects') else: context.can(server_policies.SERVERS % 'index:get_all_projects')
deleted_lines: context.can(server_policies.SERVERS % 'detail:get_all_tenants') else: context.can(server_policies.SERVERS % 'index:get_all_tenants')

commit_message:
Remove unstable_test decorator

Removes unstable_test decorator from
test_server_connectivity_cold_migration_revert test
since the related bug seems to be gone and the test
passes in most of the jobs.

Closes-Bug: 1836595
Change-Id: Ifc691971c71d89615d0e789cf6df884d2224047d

subject: Changing minimum TLL filed to "0" instead of "1" according RFC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-04-26 11:26:34.000000000', 'files': ['designate/objects/zone.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/6933666ad673c3cf3af436c3e91e81b0a37752c7', 'message': 'Changing minimum TLL filed to "0" instead of "1" according RFC

RFC: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2181#section-8
8. Time to Live (TTL)

   The definition of values appropriate to the TTL field in STD 13 is
   not as clear as it could be, with respect to how many significant
   bits exist, and whether the value is signed or unsigned.  It is
   hereby specified that a TTL value is an unsigned number, with a
   minimum value of 0, and a maximum value of 2147483647.

Change-Id: I2635a3532764bf68ac6a14eac924ab2a7d4b410a
'}]
commit_message:
Changing minimum TLL filed to "0" instead of "1" according RFC

RFC: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2181#section-8
8. Time to Live (TTL)

   The definition of values appropriate to the TTL field in STD 13 is
   not as clear as it could be, with respect to how many significant
   bits exist, and whether the value is signed or unsigned.  It is
   hereby specified that a TTL value is an unsigned number, with a
   minimum value of 0, and a maximum value of 2147483647.

Change-Id: I2635a3532764bf68ac6a14eac924ab2a7d4b410a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/59/787959/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'ttl': fields.IntegerFields(nullable=True, minimum=0,
deleted_lines: 'ttl': fields.IntegerFields(nullable=True, minimum=1,

subject: Fix bindep for EL9 platforms
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-13 14:06:44.000000000', 'files': ['bindep.txt'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/1742a8675937e8c52bb640ceca34ab6eb5b69cad', 'message': "Fix bindep for EL9 platforms

Currently it tries to install libselinux-python and
libsemanage-python with bindep but those rpms are
only applicable to EL7 platforms.

Since we no longer support python2, let's cleanup
python2 specific rpms and use rpm names which
are applicable to all rpm distros.
python3-libselinux and python3-libsemanage should
be installable on EL7, EL8, EL9 and fedora platform.

Change-Id: I49d7d599fb6c158237de2180e2a0ff15a79b4c80
"}]
commit_message:
Fix bindep for EL9 platforms

Currently it tries to install libselinux-python and
libsemanage-python with bindep but those rpms are
only applicable to EL7 platforms.

Since we no longer support python2, let's cleanup
python2 specific rpms and use rpm names which
are applicable to all rpm distros.
python3-libselinux and python3-libsemanage should
be installable on EL7, EL8, EL9 and fedora platform.

Change-Id: I49d7d599fb6c158237de2180e2a0ff15a79b4c80
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/85/849685/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: python3-libselinux [platform:rpm] python3-libsemanage [platform:rpm]
deleted_lines: libselinux-python [platform:rpm !platform:rhel-8 !platform:centos-8 !platform:fedora] libsemanage-python [platform:redhat !platform:rhel-8 !platform:centos-8 !platform:fedora] libselinux-python3 [platform:rpm !platform:rhel-7 !platform:centos-7 !platform:fedora] libsemanage-python3 [platform:redhat !platform:rhel-7 !platform:centos-7 !platform:fedora] python3-libselinux [platform:rpm platform:fedora] python3-libsemanage [platform:rpm platform:fedora]

commit_message:
Fix malformed hiera file for ovn_chassis_mac_map

The hiera file was constructed without the ovn_chassis_mac_map key so
it wouldn't match up with puppet variable.

commit_message:
Remove ineffective ovn_remote_probe_interval

This parameter was introduced to puppet-neutron but it was completely
wrong and the actual parameter has never been implemented in neutron.

Also, the parameter definition in tht has never taken effect because
puppet-tripleo overrides the definition.

The interval should be configured in ovn controller, and this is
already implemented using puppet-ovn.

Related-Bug: rhbz#2105312
Change-Id: I36499dccef6ff74a288942bd0a8f0257187387e7
(cherry picked from commit c11604c1406b2c11b862bdfc3bb5d5a40831d381)

commit_message:
db: Don't pass strings to Connection.execute

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warning:

  Passing a string to Connection.execute() is deprecated and will be
  removed in version 2.0.  Use the text() construct, or the
  Connection.exec_driver_sql() method to invoke a driver-level SQL
  string.

commit_message:
Fix to is_ca_ready() which used read_role() incorrectly

A recent change (1) switched to the newer methods in
hvac 11.2, but unfortunately the semantics between
client.secrets.pki.read_role() and client.read() are different,
in that the latter returns None on InvalidPath, whereas the former
allow the exception to bubble up.

Also updates tests and fixes a mocking issue on service_reload.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/charm-vault/+/848205

Change-Id: Id3d112104b1aa45b242e402709fb855131d5203e

deleted_lines: if role == "role": return "role info"

commit_message:
Remove manual __signature__ setting on wrappers

The primary reason to set __signature__ is to cache the generated
inspect.Signature object in a case where you're calling
inspect.signature() multiple times on a function, which we don't
currently do.

The accompanying unit test demonstrates that you don't need to
set __signature__ when using functools.wraps.

Change-Id: I47cbc373d985dde98bdb176f0ff0561783629f7d

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Tests for db api code.""" import functools import inspect import ddt from cinder.db.sqlalchemy import api as db_api from cinder.tests.unit import test @ddt.ddt class DbDecoratorTestCase(test.TestCase): """Test cases for decorators.""" @ddt.data(db_api.require_context, db_api.require_admin_context) def test_function_signature_is_correct(self, wrapper): wrapper_sig = inspect.signature(wrapper) def to_be_wrapped(context, one, two=None, three=33): pass to_be_wrapped_sig = inspect.signature(to_be_wrapped) self.assertNotEqual(wrapper_sig, to_be_wrapped_sig) wrapped = wrapper(to_be_wrapped) wrapped_sig = inspect.signature(wrapped) self.assertNotEqual(wrapper_sig, wrapped_sig) self.assertEqual(to_be_wrapped_sig, wrapped_sig)

commit_message:
db: Pass case.whens as positionals, not a list

Resolve the following RemovedIn20Warning warnings:

  The "whens" argument to case() is now passed using positional style
  only, not as a keyword argument.

  The "whens" argument to case(), when referring to a sequence of items,
  is now passed as a series of positional elements, rather than as a
  list.

Change-Id: I8f9dec66a401103b3c4eced99a3fabb19655da10
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Domain names in metadata

Currently, there is no way for a user booting an instance to tell the
instance's guest operating system what is the domain name of the instance.
Using Fully Qualified Domain Names (FQDN) as the instance hostname was
unintentionally allowed for a period of time, but with the merging of [1] that
ability went away.

Neutron is working on a feature to expose a network's ``dns_domain`` field via
the DHCP agent to the guest operating system [2].

However, if cloud-init is running in the guest, cloud-init may overwrite the
domain name provided by DHCP. Cloud-init uses the Nova metadata API as an
information source. An instance may have multiple ports, each belonging to a
distinct network with a distinct ``dns_domain``. The purpose of this spec is to
provides these domain names in the instance metadata.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/764482
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-specs/+/832658

Change-Id: Ia60ecfb277844cd6b7cfa8b4f2eb968998f4ab3e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova-specs refs/changes/74/840974/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ======================== Domain names in metadata ======================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/domain-names-in-metadata Currently, there is no way for a user booting an instance to tell the instance's guest operating system what is the domain name of the instance. Using Fully Qualified Domain Names (FQDN) as the instance hostname was unintentionally allowed for a period of time, but with the merging of [1] that ability went away. Neutron is working on a feature to expose a network's ``dns_domain`` field via the DHCP agent to the guest operating system [2]. However, if cloud-init is running in the guest, cloud-init may overwrite the domain name provided by DHCP. Cloud-init uses the Nova metadata API as an information source. An instance may have multiple ports, each belonging to a distinct network with a distinct ``dns_domain``. The purpose of this spec is to provides these domain names in the instance metadata. Problem description =================== There is currently no way to set per-instance, per-network, or per-tenant, domain names on instances. On the Nova side, the ``[api]dhcp_domain`` config option is used by the metadata API when constructing the hostname to expose in the metadata. This config option applies to the entire cloud. On the Neutron side, the ``[DEFAULT]dns_domain`` config option is similarly applicable to te entire deployment. While it is possible to set the ``dns_domain`` field on a Neutron network, this information is not currently communicated to the guests in any way. Use Cases --------- As a cloud operator, I have set the `dns_domain` name on my provider networks, and I want instances on those networks to be aware of the domain name(s) they belong to. Proposed change =============== This spec purposefully concentrates on the operator-with-provider-networks use case. The logic also applies to user-created networks. If a user wants to provide a hostname to their instance directly via the Nova REST API, this is discussed in the alternatives section. Networks's ``dns_domain`` will be exposed in both the EC2 metadata, as well as the OpenStack metadata. EC2 metadata is presented as a hierarchy of "categories" [3], similar to a path on a filesystem, or a series of nested dicts, with each sub-category corresponding to a the nested keys. A category already exists for the instance's FQDN: ``network/interfaces/macs/<mac>/public-hostname``. This spec will populate this category with an FQDN constructed from the instance hostname and the network's ``dns_domain``. In JSON form, an example would look as follows. .. code-block:: json { "network": { "interfaces": { "macs": { "00:dd:ee:dd:dd:00": { "public_hostname": "instance.network-1.example.com", }, "00:dd:ee:dd:dd:01": { "public_hostname": "instance.network-2.example.com", } } } } } For the OpenStack metadata, the schema [4] will be extended to add a ``domain`` key to the existing ``networks`` array in the network metadata. An example would look as follows. .. code-block:: json { "networks": [ { "id": "network-1", "link": "tapcd9f6d46-4a", "network_id": "99e88329-f20d-4741-9593-25bf07847b16", "type": "ipv4_dhcp", "domain": "network-1.example.com }, { "id": "network-2", "link": "tapcd9f6d46-4b", "network_id": "99e88329-f20d-4741-9593-25bf07847b17", "type": "ipv4_dhcp", "domain": "network-2.example.com } ] } Alternatives ------------ An alternative is to avoid exposing multiple interfaces, each with their own domain name. Such an alternative would set the ``hostname`` in the metadata to an FQDN made up of the instance hostname and a ``dns_domain`` value. The problem with such an approach is the handling of instances with multiple ports on multiple networks, each with their own ``dns_domain``. In such cases, there is no eminently correct way to decide which network's ``dns_domain`` should be used. As a complement to this operator-focused spec, a more user-facing enhancement would be add a ``domain`` parameter to the instance boot POST request. It could then be exposed in the metadata API, either by reusing the existing ``hostname`` field and setting the value to an FQDN, or by introducing a new ``domain`` or ``fqdn`` field. The EC2 schema already includes the ``public-hostname`` category for exactly this purpose [3]. Data model impact ----------------- None. REST API impact --------------- Security impact --------------- None. Notifications impact -------------------- None. Other end user impact --------------------- None. Performance Impact ------------------ None. Other deployer impact --------------------- None. Developer impact ---------------- None. Upgrade impact -------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: notartom Feature Liaison --------------- Feature liaison: None. Work Items ---------- * Start supporting ``dns_domain`` in Nova's ``Network`` model. Nova currently whitelists the fields it copies from Neutron, so ``dns_domain`` has to be added explicitly to the model and to the code that refreshes Nova's cache from Neutron. * Extend the EC2 metadata to start generating the ``network/interfaces/macs/<mac>`` category. * Add the ``domain`` key to the ``networks`` list in the OpenStack network metadata. * Functional tests. * Documentation. Dependencies ============ This is a related Neutron spec [2], but strictly speaking they are independant. It is possible to expose domain name information in the metadata without also exposing it in DHCP. Testing ======= This can be tested with functional tests by extending the Neutron fixture to support the DNS integration extension, and adding ``dns_domain`` fields to its networks. Documentation Impact ==================== The metadata service documentation will be updated. References ========== [1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/764482 [2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron-specs/+/832658 [3] https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/instancedata-data-categories.html [4] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/user/metadata.html#openstack-format-metadata History ======= .. list-table:: Revisions :header-rows: 1 * - Release Name - Description * - Zed - Introduced

commit_message:
Add release note for OVN "requested-chassis" feature

This patch adds the missing release note for [1].

[1]https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/828455/6

Trivial-Fix

Change-Id: I544128e0e4813acd851b5e48b4c352c3fb62c869
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/82/849082/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- features: - | Enabled the support for ``Port_Binding.additional_chassis``. This parameter is used during the live migration and provides information about the destination chassis (host) of a logical switch port. The current and the destination chassis are added to the logical switch port ``requested_chassis`` field as a list. Any traffic from the destination host port, when created, is blocked until libvirt sends a RARP packet to inform the network about the new location.

commit_message:
Replaces tenant_id with project_id from List/Show usage APIs

This patch replaces 'tenant' with 'project' from bellow APIs:

- ``GET /os-simple-tenant-usage (List Tenant Usage Statistics For All Tenants)``
- ``GET /os-simple-tenant-usage/{tenant_id} (Show Usage Statistics For Tenant)``

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id

Change-Id: I66428801f6fa55be72eaf5232d7ebd95212c576c

subject: 3PAR: Allow iSCSI driver to be enabled for Primera 4.2 onwards.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-12-07 14:30:00.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/configuration/block-storage/drivers/hpe-3par-driver.rst', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_iscsi.py', 'releasenotes/notes/hpe-3par-primera-add-iscsi-5af339643dfa0928.yaml', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/hpe/test_hpe3par.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/c0e8eda0dce9f63488db59f9d2c71f538c75cd51', 'message': '3PAR: Allow iSCSI driver to be enabled for Primera 4.2 onwards.

For HPE Primera 4.2 or higher versions, now iSCSI driver is

commit_message:
3PAR: Allow iSCSI driver to be enabled for Primera 4.2 onwards.

For HPE Primera 4.2 or higher versions, now iSCSI driver is
supported along with existing FC driver.
Accordingly updated code and documentation.

Change-Id: Ie2542fc4b21050c4f14aea67ea488d9f9eeaae79
(cherry picked from commit 6cabe11c9207376f905db3a0bcadf6d43e2c2af1)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/28/820628/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: is_primera=False, wsapi_version=wsapi_version_latest): _m_client.getWsApiVersion.return_value = wsapi_version def test_iscsi_primera_old(self): # primera 4.0.xx.yyy wsapi_version_primera_old = {'major': 1, 'build': 40000128, 'minor': 8, 'revision': 1} is_primera=True, wsapi_version=wsapi_version_primera_old) def test_iscsi_primera_new(self, config=None, mock_conf=None): # primera 4.2.xx.yyy wsapi_version_primera_new = {'major': 1, 'build': 40202010, 'minor': 8, 'revision': 1} self.ctxt = context.get_admin_context() mock_client = self.setup_mock_client( conf=config, m_conf=mock_conf, driver=hpedriver.HPE3PARISCSIDriver, is_primera=True, wsapi_version=wsapi_version_primera_new) expected_get_cpgs = [ mock.call.getCPG(HPE3PAR_CPG), mock.call.getCPG(HPE3PAR_CPG2)] expected_get_ports = [mock.call.getPorts()] expected_primera = [ mock.call.is_primera_array(), mock.call.getWsApiVersion()] mock_client.assert_has_calls( self.standard_login + expected_get_cpgs + self.standard_logout + expected_primera + self.standard_login + expected_get_ports + self.standard_logout)

commit_message:
Replace tenant_id with project_id in os-quota-sets path

This patch replaces 'tenant_id' with 'project_id' from bellow APIs:

- ``GET /os-quota-sets/{project_id} (Show A Quota)``
- ``PUT /os-quota-sets/{project_id} (Update Quotas)``
- ``GET /os-quota-sets/{project_id}/defaults (List Default Quotas For Project)``
- ``GET /os-quota-sets/{project_id}/detail (Show The Detail of Quota)``

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id

Change-Id: I3cd27a590bba89454194982efc14e42e9b4c643c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/51/768851/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Update known issue for iDRAC Swift firmware update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-13 08:28:06.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/known-issue-idrac-firmware-swift-fixed-f9d30e60a53d96c4.yaml', 'doc/source/admin/drivers/idrac.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/44ddd57efd3aa4972466c1e1baa1b3d9632f7250', 'message': 'Update known issue for iDRAC Swift firmware update

Change-Id: Ie5b9ce3ed2a9b1cd61d51f64d72403f7dbc5367b
(cherry picked from commit 70812aa6edadf87eb04b0661c204693fa98c3dd4)

commit_message:
Update known issue for iDRAC Swift firmware update

The issue is fixed in iDRAC firmware 6.00.00.00.

Change-Id: Ie5b9ce3ed2a9b1cd61d51f64d72403f7dbc5367b
(cherry picked from commit 70812aa6edadf87eb04b0661c204693fa98c3dd4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/34/849634/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Firmware update from Swift fails before 6.00.00.00 -------------------------------------------------- With iDRAC firmware prior to 6.00.00.00 and when using Swift to stage firmware update files in Management interface ``firmware_update`` clean step of ``redfish`` or ``idrac`` hardware type, the cleaning fails with error "An internal error occurred. Unable to complete the specified operation." in iDRAC job. This is fixed in iDRAC firmware 6.00.00.00. If cannot upgrade, then use HTTP service to stage firmware files for iDRAC.
deleted_lines: Firmware update from Swift fails -------------------------------- When using Swift to stage firmware update files in Management interface ``firmware_update`` clean step of ``redfish`` or ``idrac`` hardware type, the cleaning fails with error "An internal error occurred. Unable to complete the specified operation." in iDRAC job. Until this is fixed, use HTTP service to stage firmware files for iDRAC.

commit_message:
Update minimum openstacksdk version to 0.59.0

This commit bumps openstacksdk to at least 0.59.0 in requirements.txt
and removes the workarounds that we carried to actually support 0.36.0.

Change-Id: I5a5a37b621521cab9d7a8b7634b9392fc70b3c39

commit_message:
Replace os-simple-tenant-usage with os-simple-project-usage

This patch replaces 'os-simple-tenant-usage' with
'os-simple-project-usage', and changed tenant-* to proejct-*.

And changed the '/os-simple-tenant-usage' url path  to
'/os-simple-project-usage'.

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id

Change-Id: I62efd6b1334f70146c62d145661df1bac49912dc
Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

commit_message:
Skip Enable cleanup service in check mode

service/systemd check_mode fails[1] when service not found on host,
we should skip the task instead.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/pull/68136

Change-Id: I88f82e0eac5fa35b7a6de9ef20e936ef35a47891
(cherry picked from commit 3178759035031015ec1d5b76d9e8f3b1009619ad)

commit_message:
[train-only] Add deprecation notice to rear heat template

The heat template that installs ReaR on controllers is deprecated as of
16.2, and will be removed from 17.0 onwards. A deprecation notice has
been added to highlight the fact.

Related-Bug: rhbz#2097611
Change-Id: Ic01c44ba35b6d28cb45879b1006633ac1fcf8d08

subject: RBD: Fix disconnect_volume for encrypted volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-14 11:12:56.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/utils.py', 'os_brick/tests/test_utils.py', 'releasenotes/notes/rbd-disconnect-failure-9efa6932df40271b.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/3aa5d295821d6bb39a24f465b740f9ac4fb884d1', 'message': 'RBD: Fix disconnect_volume for encrypted volumes

After change Ie373ab050dcc0a35c749d9a53b6cf5ca060bcb58 closing bugs
connector was broken for encrypted volumes:

<== disconnect_volume:
   exception (0ms) AttributeError("'RBDVolumeIOWrapper' object has
   no attribute 'startswith'") trace_logging_wrapper
   /usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/os_brick/utils.py:162

This hapens because "_device_path_from_symlink" doesn't take into

case.

Closes-Bug: #1981455
Change-Id: Ib001e2b4d1347754c2b46730bc10d86e8cdab7ad
(cherry picked from commit dde8f102b714e2e4001a3fe82f975cd9978ac1c5)

'}]
commit_message:
RBD: Fix disconnect_volume for encrypted volumes

After change Ie373ab050dcc0a35c749d9a53b6cf5ca060bcb58 closing bugs
connector was broken for encrypted volumes:

<== disconnect_volume:
   exception (0ms) AttributeError("'RBDVolumeIOWrapper' object has
   no attribute 'startswith'") trace_logging_wrapper
   /usr/lib/python3.9/site-packages/os_brick/utils.py:162

This hapens because "_device_path_from_symlink" doesn't take into
account of the file handle, and we were missing a unit test for this
case.

Closes-Bug: #1981455
Change-Id: Ib001e2b4d1347754c2b46730bc10d86e8cdab7ad
(cherry picked from commit dde8f102b714e2e4001a3fe82f975cd9978ac1c5)
(cherry picked from commit 743002cc269ac1e91d8df2eee5f4fdad3d14c365)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/05/849805/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | RBD connector `bug #1981455 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1981455>`_: Fixed AttributeError error on disconnect for RBD encrypted volumes not using host attachments.

commit_message:
Replaces tenant_id with project_id from Rebuild Server API

This patch replaces 'tenant_id' with 'project_id' in response body of
Rebuild Server (rebuild Action) API ``POST /servers/{server_id}/action``

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id
Change-Id: If3a1ce7acbf5215401a546183187e65decc0765d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/80/766380/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: image_uuid = '76fa36fc-c930-4bf3-8c8a-ea2a2420deb6' def test_rebuild_response_show_tenant_id_old_version(self): body = {'rebuild': {"imageRef": self.image_uuid}} req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank(self.path_with_query % 'unknown=1', use_admin_context=True, version='2.87') fake_get = fakes.fake_compute_get( vm_state=vm_states.ACTIVE, project_id=req.environ['nova.context'].project_id, user_id=req.environ['nova.context'].user_id) self.mock_get.side_effect = fake_get res_dict = self.controller._action_rebuild(req, FAKE_UUID, body=body).obj self.assertIn('tenant_id', res_dict['server']) self.assertNotIn('project_id', res_dict['server']) def test_rebuild_response_show_project_id(self): body = {'rebuild': {"imageRef": self.image_uuid}} req = fakes.HTTPRequest.blank(self.path_with_query % 'unknown=1', use_admin_context=True, version=self.wsgi_api_version) fake_get = fakes.fake_compute_get( vm_state=vm_states.ACTIVE, project_id=req.environ['nova.context'].project_id, user_id=req.environ['nova.context'].user_id) self.mock_get.side_effect = fake_get res_dict = self.controller._action_rebuild(req, FAKE_UUID, body=body).obj self.assertNotIn('tenant_id', res_dict['server']) self.assertIn('project_id', res_dict['server'])

commit_message:
Replaces tenant_id with project_id from List SG API

This patch replaces 'tenant_id' with 'project_id' in response of List Security
Groups By Server API ``GET /servers/{server_id}/os-security-groups``.

Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id

Change-Id: I4251d9944ff64ff82cb26cf0ff5abed88ed7b740

commit_message:
requirements: Remove explicit pyparsing dependency

This was added nearly a decade ago to work around a packaging bug in
cmd2. We don't use this explicitly ourselves so we can and should remove
it. Do that.

Change-Id: Ia6061a22b9037d157c0b2afecb4e06bbc62c2d74
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix error when list database instances

When list database instances, you can't because
we doing return with wrong self.addresses in db_info

Story: #2010077
Task: #45568
Change-Id: I3275f605e03e6c74b744b29178de380ed2521425

commit_message:
Add Python 3.10 functional jobs

These are currently non-voting since we don't care about this stuff for
Zed. It does get us ready for a 3.10-having future, however.

Change-Id: Ie10d8c187e0c99235945ad12f149c6291601c008
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ignore molcule files for deployment jobs

Any change in molecule test files does not affect functionality. Thus
there is no need to run jobs which involves deployment if only the test
files are updated.

Change-Id: Ia5cfbee55f094486eaed9f5fd51316654b57025b

commit_message:
tripleo_kernel: update for standalone roles

Aligns the defaults in the role with the overcloud defaults from
tripleo-heat-templates.

Change-Id: I80a274d794eb38b3e751bf4ffd2ad499b1af3cc6
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/95/841795/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: tripleo_kernel_sysctl_extra_settings: net.ipv6.conf.default.disable_ipv6: value: 0 net.ipv4.ip_local_reserved_ports: value: "35357,49000-49001" net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6: value: 0 net.ipv6.conf.lo.disable_ipv6: value: 0 net.ipv4.ip_forward: value: 1 net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter: value: 1 net.ipv6.conf.all.forwarding: value: 0 net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind: value: 1 net.ipv6.ip_nonlocal_bind: value: 1 kernel.pid_max: value: 1048576 net.ipv4.neigh.default.gc_thresh1: value: 1024 net.ipv4.neigh.default.gc_thresh2: value: 2048 net.ipv4.neigh.default.gc_thresh3: value: 4096 net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-arptables: value: 1 net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables: value: 1 net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip6tables: value: 1 fs.inotify.max_user_instances: value: 1024
deleted_lines: tripleo_kernel_sysctl_extra_settings: {}

commit_message:
tripleo_bootstrap: update for standalone roles

tripleo_bootstrap/tasks/main.yml is broken out into bootstrap.yml and
puppet.yml tasks so that those can be individually selected. main.yml
imports both for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: Ia8fa9c32d54a7e143cdbb85cde73d30532288daf
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add openinfra/way to Zuul

Once the empty repository has been created, add it to Zuul so an
initial change will be able to merge with the relevant boilerplate.

Change-Id: I1e8bfee1b8f1faa87bdd022a4d2416008a7f6cf6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/77/849577/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - openinfra/way

subject: Configure ovn sb connection for the ovn provider
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-14 15:04:33.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_octavia_provider_ovn_spec.rb', 'manifests/profile/base/octavia/provider/ovn.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo/commit/15f1f8b33c815c55fc1aafbf582bbddfa85794b7', 'message': 'Configure ovn sb connection for the ovn provider

The OVN provider requires connections to the OVN sb db in order to
receive events for associating FIP/VIPs and healthchecks.

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/octavia/provider/ovn.pp
	spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_octavia_provider_ovn_spec.rb

Change-Id: I0b2250aa2d98e6ed02ccb7194183ebdcede97c9e
(manually cherry picked from commit 555a09de74402ffa53c0b461820e7344537961a3)

commit_message:
Configure ovn sb connection for the ovn provider

The OVN provider requires connections to the OVN sb db in order to
receive events for associating FIP/VIPs and healthchecks.

Conflicts:
	manifests/profile/base/octavia/provider/ovn.pp
	spec/classes/tripleo_profile_base_octavia_provider_ovn_spec.rb

Change-Id: I0b2250aa2d98e6ed02ccb7194183ebdcede97c9e
(manually cherry picked from commit 555a09de74402ffa53c0b461820e7344537961a3)

Change-Id: Id3996bfde41c326f30960462b1f7aeca5f059980
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/70/849870/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*ovn_sb_port*] # (Optional) Port number on which southbound database is listening # Defaults to hiera('ovn::southbound::port', undef) ## [*ovn_sb_private_key*] # (optional) The PEM file with private key for SSL connection to OVN-SB-DB # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*ovn_sb_certificate*] # (optional) The PEM file with certificate that certifies the # private key specified in ovn_sb_private_key # Defaults to $::os_service_default # # [*ovn_sb_ca_cert*] # (optional) The PEM file with CA certificate that OVN should use to # verify certificates presented to it by SSL peers # Defaults to $::os_service_default # $ovn_sb_port = hiera('ovn::southbound::port', undef), $ovn_nb_ca_cert = $::os_service_default, $ovn_sb_private_key = $::os_service_default, $ovn_sb_certificate = $::os_service_default, $ovn_sb_ca_cert = $::os_service_default # NOTE(beagles): there is no backwards compatible case for the sb_port but I'm # adding this line for consistency. $ovn_sb_port_real = $ovn_sb_port $ovn_sb_port_real = $ovn_sb_port $ovn_sb_port_real = $ovn_sb_port $sb_conn = $ovn_db_hosts_real.map |$h| { join([$protocol, normalize_ip_for_uri($h), "${ovn_sb_port_real}"].filter |$c| { !$c.empty() }, ':') } ovn_sb_connection => join(any2array($sb_conn), ','), ovn_sb_private_key => $ovn_sb_private_key, ovn_sb_certificate => $ovn_sb_certificate, ovn_sb_ca_cert => $ovn_sb_ca_cert,
deleted_lines: $ovn_nb_ca_cert = $::os_service_default

commit_message:
Validate vip address

Validates if the provided vip address(es) are in the subnet that the unit is in. If not, shows the message with invalid vips along with 'blocked' status.

Closes-Bug: #1958178
Change-Id: I6bb3e21f3934d6d2483564fba9216504a62d15dc
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone refs/changes/97/849497/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: get_invalid_vips, #Check if any of the vips are invalid invalid_vips = get_invalid_vips() if invalid_vips: return('blocked', f'Invalid vips: {invalid_vips}')

commit_message:
Adds DataCore Volume Drivers

The iSCSI and Fibre Channel volume drivers for DataCore’s
SANsymphony and Hyper-converged Virtual SAN storage
support the core/minimum feature set:
 - Volume Create/Delete
 - Volume Attach/Detach
 - Snapshot Create/Delete
 - Create Volume from Snapshot
 - Get Volume Stats
 - Copy Image to Volume
 - Copy Volume to Image
 - Clone Volume
 - Extend Volume

Implements: blueprint datacore-volume-driver

Change-Id: If0fc0e1993ad3430022be3d522ccf9bd27ef9c31
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/39/689539/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """Unit tests for the Fibre Channel Driver for DataCore SANsymphony storage array. """ import mock from cinder import exception as cinder_exception from cinder import test from cinder.tests.unit.volume.drivers.datacore import test_datacore_driver from cinder.volume.drivers.datacore import fc PORTS = [ mock.Mock(Id='initiator_port_id1', PortType='FibreChannel', PortMode='Initiator', PortName='AA-AA-AA-AA-AA-AA-AA-AA', HostId='client_id1'), mock.Mock(Id='initiator_port_id2', PortType='FibreChannel', PortMode='Initiator', PortName='BB-BB-BB-BB-BB-BB-BB-BB'), mock.Mock(Id='target_port_id1', PortMode='Target', PortName='CC-CC-CC-CC-CC-CC-CC-CC', HostId='server_id1'), mock.Mock(Id='target_port_id2', PortMode='Target', PortName='DD-DD-DD-DD-DD-DD-DD-DD', HostId='server_id1'), ] LOGICAL_UNITS = [ mock.Mock(VirtualTargetDeviceId='target_device_id1', Lun=mock.Mock(Quad=4)), mock.Mock(VirtualTargetDeviceId='target_device_id2', Lun=mock.Mock(Quad=3)), mock.Mock(VirtualTargetDeviceId='target_device_id3', Lun=mock.Mock(Quad=2)), mock.Mock(VirtualTargetDeviceId='target_device_id4', Lun=mock.Mock(Quad=1)), ] TARGET_DEVICES = [ mock.Mock(Id='target_device_id1', TargetPortId='target_port_id1', InitiatorPortId='initiator_port_id1'), mock.Mock(Id='target_device_id2', TargetPortId='target_port_id2', InitiatorPortId='initiator_port_id1'), mock.Mock(Id='target_device_id3', TargetPortId='target_port_id2', InitiatorPortId='initiator_port_id1'), mock.Mock(Id='target_device_id4', TargetPortId='target_port_id2', InitiatorPortId='initiator_port_id2'), ] class FibreChannelVolumeDriverTestCase( test_datacore_driver.DataCoreVolumeDriverTestCase, test.TestCase): """Tests for the FC Driver for DataCore SANsymphony storage array.""" def setUp(self): super(FibreChannelVolumeDriverTestCase, self).setUp() self.mock_client.get_ports.return_value = PORTS self.mock_client.get_target_devices.return_value = TARGET_DEVICES @staticmethod def init_driver(config): driver = fc.FibreChannelVolumeDriver(configuration=config) driver.do_setup(None) return driver def test_validate_connector(self): driver = self.init_driver(self.setup_default_configuration()) connector = { 'host': 'host_name', 'wwpns': ['AA-AA-AA-AA-AA-AA-AA-AA'], } driver.validate_connector(connector) def test_validate_connector_failed(self): driver = self.init_driver(self.setup_default_configuration()) connector = {} self.assertRaises(cinder_exception.InvalidConnectorException, driver.validate_connector, connector) connector = {'host': 'host_name'} self.assertRaises(cinder_exception.InvalidConnectorException, driver.validate_connector, connector) connector = {'wwpns': ['AA-AA-AA-AA-AA-AA-AA-AA']} self.assertRaises(cinder_exception.InvalidConnectorException, driver.validate_connector, connector) def test_initialize_connection(self): (self.mock_client.serve_virtual_disks_to_host .return_value) = LOGICAL_UNITS virtual_disk = test_datacore_driver.VIRTUAL_DISKS[0] client = test_datacore_driver.CLIENTS[0] driver = self.init_driver(self.setup_default_configuration()) volume = test_datacore_driver.VOLUME.copy() volume['provider_location'] = virtual_disk.Id initiator_wwpns = [port.PortName.replace('-', '').lower() for port in PORTS if port.PortMode == 'Initiator'] connector = { 'host': client.HostName, 'wwpns': initiator_wwpns, } result = driver.initialize_connection(volume, connector) self.assertEqual('fibre_channel', result['driver_volume_type']) target_wwns = [port.PortName.replace('-', '').lower() for port in PORTS if port.PortMode == 'Target'] self.assertIn(result['data']['target_wwn'], target_wwns) target_wwn = result['data']['target_wwn'] target_port_id = next(( port.Id for port in PORTS if port.PortName.replace('-', '').lower() == target_wwn), None) target_device_id = next(( device.Id for device in TARGET_DEVICES if device.TargetPortId == target_port_id), None) target_lun = next(( unit.Lun.Quad for unit in LOGICAL_UNITS if unit.VirtualTargetDeviceId == target_device_id), None) self.assertEqual(target_lun, result['data']['target_lun']) self.assertFalse(result['data']['target_discovered']) self.assertEqual(volume['id'], result['data']['volume_id']) self.assertEqual('rw', result['data']['access_mode']) def test_initialize_connection_unknown_client(self): client = test_datacore_driver.CLIENTS[0] self.mock_client.register_client.return_value = client (self.mock_client.get_clients .return_value) = test_datacore_driver.CLIENTS[1:] (self.mock_client.serve_virtual_disks_to_host .return_value) = LOGICAL_UNITS virtual_disk = test_datacore_driver.VIRTUAL_DISKS[0] driver = self.init_driver(self.setup_default_configuration()) volume = test_datacore_driver.VOLUME.copy() volume['provider_location'] = virtual_disk.Id initiator_wwpns = [port.PortName.replace('-', '').lower() for port in PORTS if port.PortMode == 'Initiator'] connector = { 'host': client.HostName, 'wwpns': initiator_wwpns, } result = driver.initialize_connection(volume, connector) self.assertEqual('fibre_channel', result['driver_volume_type']) target_wwns = [port.PortName.replace('-', '').lower() for port in PORTS if port.PortMode == 'Target'] self.assertIn(result['data']['target_wwn'], target_wwns) target_wwn = result['data']['target_wwn'] target_port_id = next(( port.Id for port in PORTS if port.PortName.replace('-', '').lower() == target_wwn), None) target_device_id = next(( device.Id for device in TARGET_DEVICES if device.TargetPortId == target_port_id), None) target_lun = next(( unit.Lun.Quad for unit in LOGICAL_UNITS if unit.VirtualTargetDeviceId == target_device_id), None) self.assertEqual(target_lun, result['data']['target_lun']) self.assertFalse(result['data']['target_discovered']) self.assertEqual(volume['id'], result['data']['volume_id']) self.assertEqual('rw', result['data']['access_mode']) def test_initialize_connection_failed_not_found(self): client = test_datacore_driver.CLIENTS[0] driver = self.init_driver(self.setup_default_configuration()) volume = test_datacore_driver.VOLUME.copy() volume['provider_location'] = 'wrong_virtual_disk_id' initiator_wwpns = [port.PortName.replace('-', '').lower() for port in PORTS if port.PortMode == 'Initiator'] connector = { 'host': client.HostName, 'wwpns': initiator_wwpns, } self.assertRaises(cinder_exception.VolumeDriverException, driver.initialize_connection, volume, connector) def test_initialize_connection_failed_initiator_not_found(self): (self.mock_client.serve_virtual_disks_to_host .return_value) = LOGICAL_UNITS virtual_disk = test_datacore_driver.VIRTUAL_DISKS[0] client = test_datacore_driver.CLIENTS[0] driver = self.init_driver(self.setup_default_configuration()) volume = test_datacore_driver.VOLUME.copy() volume['provider_location'] = virtual_disk.Id connector = { 'host': client.HostName, 'wwpns': ['0000000000000000'], } self.assertRaises(cinder_exception.VolumeDriverException, driver.initialize_connection, volume, connector) def test_initialize_connection_failed_on_serve(self): self.mock_client.serve_virtual_disks_to_host.return_value = [] virtual_disk = test_datacore_driver.VIRTUAL_DISKS[0] client = test_datacore_driver.CLIENTS[0] driver = self.init_driver(self.setup_default_configuration()) volume = test_datacore_driver.VOLUME.copy() volume['provider_location'] = virtual_disk.Id initiator_wwpns = [port.PortName.replace('-', '').lower() for port in PORTS if port.PortMode == 'Initiator'] connector = { 'host': client.HostName, 'wwpns': initiator_wwpns, } self.assertRaises(cinder_exception.VolumeDriverException, driver.initialize_connection, volume, connector)

commit_message:
Handle no replicator targettoken case better

Display an informative error message if no `targettoken` was provided.

```
$ glance-replicator size az3:9292
2016-07-05 07:36:48.365 69704 CRITICAL glance [-] MissingCredentialError: Missing required credential: targettoken
...
```

Closes-Bug: #1599187

Change-Id: Ib06aa2544fbce67101d9a2c91e9ec9065ec18fa5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/29/337329/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not options.token: raise exception.MissingCredentialError(required='token')

commit_message:
Add support for using os_client_config cloud names

Instead of providing a glance URL and token, the user can provide the
name of a cloud in a `clouds.yaml` file.

Allowing a cloud name makes the tool easier to use -- e.g.:

    $ glance-replicator size az4
    $ glance-replicator compare az2 az3

Change-Id: I7e3b5714807e80797a103122373a5c3dd8ff4c80

commit_message:
Migrate glance-replicator to requests

In its current state, glance-replicator uses httplib and thus does not
properly verify HTTPS connections. Switching to requests supports automatic
certificate verification on all HTTPS connections. Also the patch adds the
command-line option for specifying a custom certificate bundle to be used when
verifying the server certificate.

Change-Id: I2ad82098b9acababb277865b400388ad0507bd58
Closes-Bug: #1408940

commit_message:
Glance replicator: move from v1 to v2

The first version of the API has been deprecated a while ago, but we
never moved glance-replicator to v2. We also remove two related options
that have been deprecated since

Change-Id: I540e2cfb67fae91822936aa565213e1693c836b6
Closes-Bug: #1830026

subject: Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-13 15:12:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/fdc4a48b7348743a1ecc8fa4678173aa8910e21f', 'message': "Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources

ServerGroup resources work as scheduler hints for server
resources and replacement of it replaces the servers which
is undesirable in many circumstances.

- We don't allow update of ServerGroup resource properties
- If not created (CREATE_FAILED) without resource_id they will
  be replaced
- If does not exist in nova they would be created
- If exist in nova, FAILED resource status would be just
  changed to COMPLETE

Task: 45748

Change-Id: I096dff2b541a5aa8afbbbcea5161e7ca1c244039
(cherry picked from commit a0e072b3204d736b9a4a5b2ceb2157f57405ac6f)
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-07-13 23:18:28.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/resources/openstack/nova/server_group.py', 'heat/tests/openstack/nova/test_server_group.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/f9f5d2cc368e5f850b962c8d89669a50544058d1', 'message': "Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources

ServerGroup resources work as scheduler hints for server
resources and replacement of it replaces the servers which
is undesirable in many circumstances.

- We don't allow update of ServerGroup resource properties
- If not created (CREATE_FAILED) without resource_id they will
  be replaced
- If does not exist in nova they would be created
- If exist in nova, FAILED resource status would be just
  changed to COMPLETE

Task: 45748

Change-Id: I096dff2b541a5aa8afbbbcea5161e7ca1c244039
(cherry picked from commit a0e072b3204d736b9a4a5b2ceb2157f57405ac6f)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't always replace FAILED ServerGroup resources

ServerGroup resources work as scheduler hints for server
resources and replacement of it replaces the servers which
is undesirable in many circumstances.

- We don't allow update of ServerGroup resource properties
- If not created (CREATE_FAILED) without resource_id they will
  be replaced
- If does not exist in nova they would be created
- If exist in nova, FAILED resource status would be just
  changed to COMPLETE

Task: 45748

Change-Id: I096dff2b541a5aa8afbbbcea5161e7ca1c244039
(cherry picked from commit a0e072b3204d736b9a4a5b2ceb2157f57405ac6f)

added_lines: from novaclient import exceptions from oslo_utils import excutils class FakeNovaPlugin(object): @excutils.exception_filter def ignore_not_found(self, ex): if not isinstance(ex, exceptions.NotFound): raise ex def is_version_supported(self, version): return True def is_conflict(self, ex): return False self.patchobject(excutils.exception_filter, '__exit__') return_value=FakeNovaPlugin()) def test_needs_replace_failed(self): self._create_sg('test') self.sg.state_set(self.sg.CREATE, self.sg.FAILED) mock_show_resource = self.patchobject(self.sg, '_show_resource') mock_show_resource.side_effect = [exceptions.NotFound(404), None] self.sg.resource_id = None self.assertTrue(self.sg.needs_replace_failed()) self.assertEqual(0, mock_show_resource.call_count) self.sg.resource_id = 'sg_id' self.assertTrue(self.sg.needs_replace_failed()) self.assertEqual(1, mock_show_resource.call_count) mock_show_resource.return_value = None self.assertFalse(self.sg.needs_replace_failed()) self.assertEqual(2, mock_show_resource.call_count)

commit_message:
Remove unstable_test decorator

Removing unstable_test decorator from
test_create_object_with_transfer_encoding method.

The test seems to be passing in most of the jobs,
therefore there is no need to have the decorator anymore.

Related-Bug: #1905432
Closes-Bug: #1905432
Change-Id: Iad12907914148b4185f4620dd5607b7d2aa09a02

commit_message:
Configure ovn sb connection for the ovn provider

The OVN provider requires connections to the OVN sb db in order to
receive events for associating FIP/VIPs and healthchecks.

Change-Id: I0b2250aa2d98e6ed02ccb7194183ebdcede97c9e

sure the description explains what is actually tested.

commit_message:
Change the default ip for the nfs server

Originally, tripleo-quickstart was used to deploy BnR development
environments, but since then, the team has migrated to use infrared
almost exclusively. This patch sets the nfs server ip addres to the
default address configured by infrared on the undercloud.

Change-Id: I243bfef4dc36b09c0129390c71b2af0cc1cd1fd9

commit_message:
Update the bundles to use the stable track, edge risk for wallaby

This update points the charms to the appropriate channel for
the charm being used, either from ceph, openstack, ovn or the
misc tracks for wallaby.

Change-Id: I3adeabbc1a5a4fba1850a99cfd3efbd327aa59e4

commit_message:
Replace os-simple-tenant-usage with os-simple-project-usage

This patch replaces 'os-simple-tenant-usage' with
'os-simple-project-usage', and changed tenant-* to proejct-*.

And changed the '/os-simple-tenant-usage' url path  to
'/os-simple-project-usage'.

Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

commit_message:
Fix, yum operations: set SELinux context for repo paths

The path to the repositories passed by the user may not have
a system context and then it may not visibile inside the container,
unless :z is specified.

The issue can be seen at least in wallaby (caught in a downstream
build), while it used to work on train (maybe different podman?),
but the addition of :z doesn't seem to break the latter branch.

Closes-Bug: #1981340
Change-Id: If14c2249da09a5d855f33abf9b68f5897aa43490

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-12 18:50:29.000000000', 'files': ['gerrit/projects.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/project-config/commit/3c6a47ca87647a91631777df57c22ec61f24e35b', 'message': 'Add a new openinfra/way project

The OpenInfra Foundation community managers are collaborating on a
document about how projects can apply The Four Opens in practical

commit_message:
Add a new openinfra/way project

The OpenInfra Foundation community managers are collaborating on a
document about how projects can apply The Four Opens in practical
terms, avoid common pitfalls, and learn hard-won lessons from
free/libre open source projects which have come before.

This project will start empty, and then once created an initial
change will add the relevant boilerplate files.

Change-Id: I98f8a91442f4b1250189af2ec1234bf2814a7a53
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/76/849576/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Replace os-simple-tenant-usage with os-simple-project-usage

This patch replaces 'os-simple-tenant-usage' with
'os-simple-project-usage', and changed tenant-* to proejct-*.

And changed the '/os-simple-tenant-usage' url path  to
'/os-simple-project-usage'.

Co-Authored-By: Wenping Song <songwenping@inspur.com>

part of blueprint remove-tenant-id
Change-Id: I62efd6b1334f70146c62d145661df1bac49912dc

Change-Id: I026488d7024a7022860158f51924993cdd911cff

commit_message:
tempurl: Deprecate sha1 signatures

We've known this would eventually be necessary for a while [1], and
way back in 2017 we started seeing SHA-1 collisions [2].

There's already a patch for Swfit from 2017[3], and this patch will
update tempest side.

[1] https://www.schneier.com/blog/archives/2012/10/when_will_we_se.html
[2] https://security.googleblog.com/2017/02/announcing-first-sha1-collision.html
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/swift/+/525771

Change-Id: I0e9073955604ada493ec64264c6a5932627e1138
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/71/832771/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: key.encode(), hmac_body.encode(), hashlib.sha256
deleted_lines: key.encode(), hmac_body.encode(), hashlib.sha1

commit_message:
Fix QoS selection for SRIOV environments

When QoS is set in the neutron-api charm, the neutron-openvswitch
charm needs to add 'extensions = qos' to the sriov_agent.ini
file.

Closes-bug: #1938277
Change-Id: I44fbf5991d2606161b1bcbc064d4bc68a2fbbb5b
(cherry picked from commit 2a6cba8e6f6c609676a713e496ffd6f44264525d)
(cherry picked from commit 561a44e9489913bd191b2854a496b25913fd045a)

commit_message:
Fixes Nova live-migration post-copy

Live migration post-copy was not working because to be effective,
'live_migration_timeout_action' must be set to 'force_complete'.

Closes-bug: #1950894
Change-Id: I66984a12b89cb0ac2aeebeb393a6f6c026d865da
(cherry picked from commit d04cbcea20915c7db6011c7e53cdc53613ee9744)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-nova-compute refs/changes/34/845634/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If live-migration is enabled, this option allows Nova to switch an on-going live migration to post-copy mode. The switch will happen if the migration reaches 'live-migration-completion-timeout'. This supersedes 'live-migration-permit-auto-converge'. CPU when an on-going live migration is slow. This is superseded by 'live-migration-permit-post-copy'.
deleted_lines: If live-migration is enabled, this option allows Nova to switch an on- going live migration to post-copy mode. CPU when an on-going live migration is slow.

commit_message:
fup: Assert state of connection_info during LM rollback in func tests

This came up during Iea8896682fc28e3a5cd25afa45238272bee745e1 as
something we should be asserting in our func tests somewhere. I had
thought it already was but this is as close as we got. Add that coverage
here.

Change-Id: Ib8009f38f20b008d08148f7f591af13b1ca5b420
(cherry picked from commit 31bedfc09c1d35242e0b8101343f6e64ac63157d)
(cherry picked from commit c248986eeb8e9b9c3586c83b01663d3585132c3f)

added_lines: from oslo_serialization import jsonutilsfrom nova import contextfrom nova import objects * Launch a boot from volume instance on src * Assert that the expected source attachment is recorded in the bdm * Wrap pre_live_migration on the dest and assert that we switch over to the new attachment and connection_info on the dest. * Assert that the original src connection_info is in the bdm name='test_bfv_live_migration_failure', image_uuid='', networks='none', host='src' 'uuid': volume_id, # Assert that the instance has landed correctly on src self.assertEqual('src', server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host']) # Assert that this attachment_id is stashed in the connection_info # of the bdm so we can assert things again after the failure ctxt = context.get_admin_context() bdm = objects.BlockDeviceMapping.get_by_volume_and_instance( ctxt, volume_id, server['id']) self.assertEqual(src_attachment_id, bdm.attachment_id) connection_info = jsonutils.loads(bdm.connection_info) self.assertIn('attachment_id', connection_info['data']) self.assertEqual( src_attachment_id, connection_info['data']['attachment_id']) dest_pre_live_mig = self.computes['dest'].manager.pre_live_migration # Wrap pre_live_migration on the destination so we can assert that # we do switch over to the new attachment before the failure # and then later rollback to the source attachment def wrap_pre_live_migration(*args, **kwargs): # Continue with pre_live_migration before we assert anything migrate_data = dest_pre_live_mig(*args, **kwargs) # Assert that we now have two attachments in the fixture, one for # the src and another for the dest. attachments = self.cinder.volume_to_attachment.get(volume_id) self.assertEqual(2, len(attachments)) # Assert that the dest attachment id is saved in the bdm # and the connection_info. bdm = objects.BlockDeviceMapping.get_by_volume_and_instance( ctxt, volume_id, server['id']) self.assertNotEqual(src_attachment_id, bdm.attachment_id) dest_attachment_id = bdm.attachment_id connection_info = jsonutils.loads(bdm.connection_info) self.assertIn('attachment_id', connection_info['data']) self.assertEqual( dest_attachment_id, connection_info['data']['attachment_id']) return migrate_data with mock.patch.object( self.computes['dest'].manager, 'pre_live_migration', wrap_pre_live_migration ): # Migrate the instance and wait until the migration errors out # thanks to our mocked version of live_migration raising # TestingException self._live_migrate(server, 'error', server_expected_state='ERROR') self.assertEqual('src', server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host']) # Assert that the connection_info has reverted back to the src bdm = objects.BlockDeviceMapping.get_by_volume_and_instance( ctxt, volume_id, server['id']) self.assertEqual(src_attachment_id, bdm.attachment_id) connection_info = jsonutils.loads(bdm.connection_info) self.assertIn('attachment_id', connection_info['data']) self.assertEqual( src_attachment_id, connection_info['data']['attachment_id'])
deleted_lines: * Launch a boot from volume instance name='test_bfv_live_migration_failure', image_uuid='', networks='none' 'uuid': volume_id # Fetch the source host for use later src_host = server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host'] # Migrate the instance and wait until the migration errors out thanks # to our mocked version of live_migration raising TestingException self._live_migrate(server, 'error', server_expected_state='ERROR') self.assertEqual(src_host, server['OS-EXT-SRV-ATTR:host'])

added_lines: # Dict of connection_info for the above volumes keyed by the volume id def _find_connection_info(volume_id, attachment_id): """Find the connection_info associated with an attachment :returns: A connection_info dict based on a deepcopy associated with the volume_id but containing the attachment_id, making it unique for the attachment. """ connection_info = copy.deepcopy( self.VOLUME_CONNECTION_INFO.get( volume_id, self.VOLUME_CONNECTION_INFO.get('fake') ) ) connection_info['data']['attachment_id'] = attachment_id return connection_info attachment['connection_info'] = _find_connection_info( volume_id, attachment_id) 'connection_info': _find_connection_info( volume_id, attachment_id) 'connection_info': _find_connection_info( volume_id, attachment_id)
deleted_lines: # Dict of connection_info for the above volumes key'd by the volume id # TODO(lyarwood): Make this unique and tracked per attachment somehow. connection_info = self.VOLUME_CONNECTION_INFO.get( volume_id, self.VOLUME_CONNECTION_INFO.get('fake')) attachment['connection_info'] = copy.deepcopy(connection_info) 'connection_info': copy.deepcopy( self.VOLUME_CONNECTION_INFO.get( volume_id, self.VOLUME_CONNECTION_INFO.get('fake'))) 'connection_info': copy.deepcopy( self.VOLUME_CONNECTION_INFO.get( volume_id, self.VOLUME_CONNECTION_INFO.get('fake')))
