commit_message:
ubuntu: more exact match on squashfs file, containerfile: use focal

This is a squash of two changes that have unfortunately simultaneously
broken the gate.

The functests are failing with

 sha256sum: bionic-server-cloudimg-amd64.squashfs.manifest: No such file or directory

I think what has happened here is that the SHA256 sums file being used
has got a new entry "bionic-server-cloudimg-amd64.squashfs.manifest"
which is showing up in a grep for
"bionic-server-cloudimg-amd64.squashfs".  sha256 then tries to also
check this hash, and has started failing.

To avoid this, add an EOL marker to the grep so it only matches the
exact filename.

Change I7fb585bc5ccc52803eea107e76dddf5e9fde8646 updated the
containerfile tests to Jammy and it seems that cgroups v2 prevents
podman running inside docker [1].  While we investigate, move this
testing back to focal.

[1] https://github.com/containers/podman/issues/14884
Change-Id: I1af9f5599168aadc1e7fcdfae281935e6211a597

commit_message:
Make allowed_cidrs optional for listener

An additional parameter test_allowed_cidrs has been
added to allow the execution of tests using it or not
on creation/updating listeners. By default this
parameter will be load True.

Change-Id: I3646f06f65f66b99423f6d0b1498127317ac5cde

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-12 14:47:48.000000000', 'files': ['roles/standalone/tasks/ceph-install.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/commit/d15113f5ccb06999906c5ca712e4c3676909a1a4', 'message': 'Handle tripleo_ceph_deploy_container_namespace per scenario

I1abfbbd23ca93c01393d05057806ba9cc846fbed fixed LP 1978998
by having the tripleo_ceph_deploy role get its container
not from an unavailable undercloud registry but from
quay.rdoproject.org. That avoids one problem but breaks
tripleo-ci-centos-9-scenario00{1,4}-ceph-nightly periodic

use quay.io/ceph/daemon:latest and the container vars are
already set correctly.

Set tripleo_ceph_deploy_container_namespace correctly per
scenario with a new task to detect the scenario and set
it accordingly.

Change-Id: I3bff2e0b6930dfbbbd1ce01265f40e70df753128
Closes-Bug: #1981329
'}]
commit_message:
Handle tripleo_ceph_deploy_container_namespace per scenario

I1abfbbd23ca93c01393d05057806ba9cc846fbed fixed LP 1978998
by having the tripleo_ceph_deploy role get its container
not from an unavailable undercloud registry but from
quay.rdoproject.org. That avoids one problem but breaks
tripleo-ci-centos-9-scenario00{1,4}-ceph-nightly periodic
since quay.rdoproject.org/tripleomastercentos9 does not
have daemon:latest-pacific-devel which causes LP 1981329.

As per https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/rdo-jobs/+/42583,
we need tripleo-ci-centos-9-scenario00{1,4}-ceph-nightly to
use quay.io/ceph/daemon:latest and the container vars are
already set correctly.

Set tripleo_ceph_deploy_container_namespace correctly per
scenario with a new task to detect the scenario and set
it accordingly.

Change-Id: I3bff2e0b6930dfbbbd1ce01265f40e70df753128
Closes-Bug: #1981329
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/45/849545/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: Determine ceph_container_namespace based on scenario # TODO: # Add condition identifying tripleo-ci-centos-9-scenario00{1,4}-ceph-nightly # so that this fact can be set to quay.io/ceph/daemon:latest # Do not reinvent https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/rdo-jobs/+/42583 set_fact: ceph_container_namespace: "{{ (standalone_container_ceph_updates|bool) | ternary(docker_ceph_namespace, 'quay.rdoproject.org/tripleomastercentos9') }}" tripleo_ceph_deploy_container_namespace: "{{ ceph_container_namespace }}"
deleted_lines: tripleo_ceph_deploy_container_namespace: "{{ (standalone_container_ceph_updates|bool) | ternary(docker_ceph_namespace, 'quay.rdoproject.org/tripleomastercentos9') }}"

Reason for revert: According to I2f33543fa7ee65ce3d25f70af49a18b69f799aec Centos9 Stream got the fixed libvirt version libvirt-8.4.0-3.el9

commit_message:
Update project module to be compatible with new sdk

- Change sdk calls to use proxy objects
- Convert return values to dict before updating
- Adds additional test values

Change-Id: I187a27af4a5b8aa7cd4b60a1a876b5e5e6975144

deleted_lines: cloud: "{{ cloud }}" state: present name: ansible_project description: dummy description domain_id: default enabled: True- debug: var=project cloud: "{{ cloud }}" state: present name: ansible_project description: new description- debug: var=updatedproject

subject: Use cloudsmith repo for rabbit and erlang
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-16 09:36:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-rabbitmq_server/commit/e15fca14e505448405ab802ec8b9ef727f666afe', 'message': 'Use cloudsmith repo for rabbit and erlang

commit_message:
Use cloudsmith repo for rabbit and erlang

Switch to using cloudsmith repo as a source for rabbitmq and erlang.

This allows us to be consistent about repository that is
used across supported distributions along with switching from
unreliable erlang-solutions that tend to fail periodically.

Change-Id: Ia438ee3b0aa1ba95aff014776e936516b83181ec
(cherry picked from commit 4ab856bfefd07ca5fb39d66c93530e9b7ab0fe76)

commit_message:
No deploy_kernel/ramdisk with the ramdisk deploy and no cleaning

Ramdisk deploys don't use IPA, no need to provide it. Cleaning may need
the agent, so only skip verification if cleaning is disabled.

Other boot interfaces may need fixing as well, I haven't checked them.

Change-Id: Ia2739311f065e19ba539fe3df7268075d6075787
(cherry picked from commit 65583e64172a0188d125117d1f2288e105832395)

commit_message:
Fixed upload_image policy doesn't support params

Otherwise following policy won't work:
"upload_image": "rule:context_is_admin or tenant:%(owner)s"

Change-Id: I407503ee2f78c744c699bd7759c44f3b73d343ce
Signed-off-by: Pavel Glushchak <pglushchak@virtuozzo.com>

subject: Improve string representation of DB models
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-27 08:37:54.000000000', 'files': ['octavia/db/base_models.py', 'octavia/db/models.py', 'octavia/tests/functional/db/test_models.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/a57c0221b4ef29aa30be816503335949f7461dcf', 'message': 'Improve string representation of DB models

This replaces the default "<XYClass object at 0xdeadbeeff00>"
repr() for DB objects, which is pretty useless.
This change makes it easier to identify DB objects in debuggers
(and logs, if objects get logged).

__repr__() and __str__() have slightly different purposes.

The purpose of __repr__() is to return a string that uniquely identifies
a single object. __str__(), on the other hand, should produce a human
readable string. Another thing that is worth to note is that str() will
call __repr__() if __str__() is not implemented, repr() will always call
__repr__(). More details can be found under [1].

By implementing a generic __repr__() in the base class
there should be no need to override it in the models classes.
However, one might not be interested in seeing all
the object's attributes in a string representation
(which is what the generic __repr__() would do) or
certain sensitive information should be hidden from users.
In those cases it makes sense to implement __str__() for certain
classes specifically.

[1]: https://stackoverflow.com/a/2626364/6265131

Change-Id: I4c218793948b0ed7ce0c143d6c794516fdeb224f
(cherry picked from commit ff6d0c5280fbdbe8f5361469fb88448fa650f365)
(cherry picked from commit bc95e34819bed67444c752e59c01a90c0c6df89b)
(cherry picked from commit 77c86a2409a7e244c713a6d680d2d38f9f6e7bbd)
(cherry picked from commit b55247d1feaa99b7b383a0a41e1685b57a547678)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve string representation of DB models

This replaces the default "<XYClass object at 0xdeadbeeff00>"
repr() for DB objects, which is pretty useless.
This change makes it easier to identify DB objects in debuggers
(and logs, if objects get logged).

__repr__() and __str__() have slightly different purposes.

The purpose of __repr__() is to return a string that uniquely identifies
a single object. __str__(), on the other hand, should produce a human
readable string. Another thing that is worth to note is that str() will
call __repr__() if __str__() is not implemented, repr() will always call
__repr__(). More details can be found under [1].

By implementing a generic __repr__() in the base class
there should be no need to override it in the models classes.
However, one might not be interested in seeing all
the object's attributes in a string representation
(which is what the generic __repr__() would do) or
certain sensitive information should be hidden from users.
In those cases it makes sense to implement __str__() for certain
classes specifically.

[1]: https://stackoverflow.com/a/2626364/6265131

Change-Id: I4c218793948b0ed7ce0c143d6c794516fdeb224f
(cherry picked from commit ff6d0c5280fbdbe8f5361469fb88448fa650f365)
(cherry picked from commit bc95e34819bed67444c752e59c01a90c0c6df89b)
(cherry picked from commit 77c86a2409a7e244c713a6d680d2d38f9f6e7bbd)
(cherry picked from commit b55247d1feaa99b7b383a0a41e1685b57a547678)

This can result in the wrong node being unprovisioned in the following

commit_message:
Do a precise node lookup for unprovision

A hostname or name is passed to the unprovision call, and the node is
looked up by allocation name (hostname), falling back to node name.

This can result in the wrong node being unprovisioned in the following
scenario:
* node and hostname naming scheme are identical
* node and hostname names are mixed because allocation placement
  doesn't take the node name into account
* a node has already been unprovisioned by hostname (allocation)
  lookup
* unprovision is performed a second time, this time matching the
  hostname with a different node's name
* the wrong node is unprovisioned

The unprovision_node method can also take a node object instead of a
string identifier, so this change does a precise node lookup before
calling it. This means only hostnames are used for allocation lookups,
and node names for node lookups.

Change-Id: I9507f8d30c871ae62a250148789393695d59183a
Resolves: rhbz#2092444
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/metalsmith refs/changes/52/849052/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack import exceptions as os_exc connection = provisioner.connection for instance in instances: hostname = instance.get('hostname') node = None if hostname: try: allocation = connection.baremetal.get_allocation(hostname) node = connection.baremetal.get_node(allocation.node_id) except os_exc.ResourceNotFound: # Allocation for this hostname doesn't exist, so attempt # to lookup by node name pass name = instance.get('name') if not node and name: try: node = connection.baremetal.get_node(name) except os_exc.ResourceNotFound: # Node with this name doesn't exist, so there is no # node to unprovision pass if node: provisioner.unprovision_node(node)
deleted_lines: for instance in instances: provisioner.unprovision_node(instance.get('hostname', instance.get('name')))

Closes-Bug: #1930218
Change-Id: I4154f36e5c2f287f3d85fce509f302123cb4e320
"}]
commit_message:
Don't fail zap-disk if devices are separated with mult. spaces

Split list of devices on any consecutive number of whitespace instead
of failing on more than one space

Closes-Bug: #1930218
Change-Id: I4154f36e5c2f287f3d85fce509f302123cb4e320
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd refs/changes/12/793812/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch('os.path.exists', mock.MagicMock(return_value=True)) @mock.patch.object(zap_disk, 'zap_disk') def test_zap_disks_with_extra_spaces(self, _zap_disk): """Will zap disks even with extra spaces""" def side_effect(arg): return { 'devices': '/dev/vdb /dev/vdc', # note 2*SPC 'i-really-mean-it': True, }.get(arg) self.is_active_bluestore_device.return_value = False self.is_mapped_luks_device.return_value = False self.hookenv.action_get.side_effect = side_effect self.kv.get.return_value = ['/dev/vdb', '/dev/vdz'] zap_disk.zap() _zap_disk.assert_has_calls( [mock.call('/dev/vdb'), mock.call('/dev/vdc')] ) self.kv.get.assert_called_with('osd-devices', []) self.kv.set.assert_called_with('osd-devices', ['/dev/vdz']) self.hookenv.action_set.assert_called_with({ 'message': "2 disk(s) have been zapped, to use " "them as OSDs, run: \njuju " "run-action ceph-osd-test/0 add-disk " "osd-devices=\"/dev/vdb /dev/vdc\"" })

commit_message:
Set default block.db size based on osd device size

Default value of block.db (bluestore_block_db_size) is set
to 1024. However, this may end up being lower than the
recommended size of 4%. This change sets the block.db size
as the 4% of the osd device size.

Change-Id: I3f0515ce7cdbefb7a21c28fc3891f4c6a20bec5d
Closes-Bug: 1827463
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-ceph-osd refs/changes/13/733613/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import fcntlimport mathimport struct def _get_total_block_size(): """ Get the total size of OSD devices in MB. :param: none :returns: int. Total size in MB. """ db = kv() osd_devices = db.get('osd-devices', []) bytes = 0 # ioctl request: BLKGETSIZE64 req = 0x80081272 for dev in osd_devices: buf = ' ' * 8 with open(dev) as fp: buf = fcntl.ioctl(fp.fileno(), req, buf) bytes += struct.unpack('L', buf)[0] return (bytes / (1024 ** 2)) # 4% of the total block size db_size = math.ceil(_get_total_block_size() * 0.04) 'db': db_size,
